blocs.name: European Union
blocs.description: The European Union provides comprehensive data protection through GDPR and related regulations. EU member states share a common legal framework for privacy and data handling.

blocs.name: European Economic Area
blocs.description: The EEA extends the EU single market to Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein. These countries adopt EU regulations including GDPR through the EEA Agreement.

blocs.name: EU/EEA Region
blocs.description: Combined European Union and European Economic Area. Used for data residency purposes when a vendor offers 'EU data residency' without specifying exact countries. Includes all 27 EU member states plus Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein.
blocs.notes: Virtual bloc for data residency classification. Inherits all members and laws from EEA (which inherits from EU).

blocs.name: Five Eyes
blocs.description: Intelligence alliance between Australia, Canada, New Zealand, United Kingdom, and United States. Members share signals intelligence and have mutual legal assistance treaties enabling cross-border data access.
blocs.notes: While an intelligence-sharing alliance rather than a legal framework, Five Eyes membership indicates close cooperation on surveillance and data access between member nations.

blocs.name: EU Adequacy Decisions
blocs.description: Countries recognized by the European Commission as providing adequate data protection, allowing free flow of personal data from the EU without additional safeguards.
blocs.notes: Adequacy decisions can be challenged or revoked. The US Data Privacy Framework (2023) replaced Privacy Shield after Schrems II invalidation.

low.label: Low Risk
low.description: Strong data protection laws aligned with GDPR. No extraterritorial data access concerns.

moderate.label: Moderate Risk
moderate.description: Generally adequate protection with some surveillance capabilities or legal uncertainties.

elevated.label: Elevated Risk
elevated.description: Significant surveillance laws or extraterritorial data access capabilities. Consider mitigations.

high.label: High Risk
high.description: Broad government access to data, weak privacy protections, or extraterritorial reach. Avoid for sensitive data.

sanctioned.label: Sanctioned
sanctioned.description: Subject to international sanctions. Business relationships may be legally restricted.

meta.description: Jurisdictional blocs and risk level definitions for SovereignSky
